official-title.#text: To modify the boundaries of Cibola National Forest in the State of New Mexico, to transfer certain Bureau of Land Management land for inclusion in the national forest, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the
sponsor.#text: Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico

header.#text: Boundary modification and transfer of administrative jurisdiction, Cibola National Forest, New Mexico

quote.#text: Crest of Montezuma Proposed Land Transfer

text.#text: The boundaries of Cibola National Forest in the State of New Mexico, are modified to include the land depicted for such inclusion on the Forest Service map titled

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be on file and available for public inspection in the appropriate offices of the
may make technical and clerical corrections to the map.

header.#text: Transfer of Bureau of Land Management land

shall administer the permit or other land use authorization according to the terms of the permit or other land use authorization. Upon expiration of such a permit or authorization, the
may reauthorize the use covered by the permit or authorization under authorities available to the Secretary on such terms and conditions as the Secretary considers in the public interest.

text.#text: In the case of any permit or other land use authorization for public land transferred under

header.#text: Effect of transfer on existing permits

text.#text: Subject to the appropriation of funds to carry out this subsection and the consent of the owner of private land included within the boundaries of Cibola National Forest by

text.#text: Any federally owned lands that have been or hereafter may be acquired for National Forest System purposes within the boundaries of Cibola National Forest, as modified by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and in accordance with the other laws and regulations pertaining to the National Forest System.

header.#text: Withdrawal From Mining and Certain Other Uses

all forms of entry, appropriation, or disposal under the public land laws;
location, entry, and patent under the public land mining laws; and
operation of the mineral leasing and geothermal leasing laws and the mineral materials laws.
